ca.uwo.csd.piil
Class Solver


java.lang.Object

  ca.uwo.csd.piil.Solver


public class Solver
extends java.lang.Object

Solver class implements methods to produce interpretation scheme/pattern for a set of propositional partial information ionic logic formulas using analytic tableau method. Work flows as follows:

                         solve([a->b, -b])
                                |
                            [-b, a->b]
                                |
                         expand([-b, a->b])
                                |
                           applyRule(-b)
                                |
                       expand([NPT b, a->b])
                                |
                         applyRule(a -> b)
                          /            \
           expand([NPT b, NPT a])   expand([NPT b, T b])
                 |                             |
     checkClosure([NPT b, NPT a])   checkClosure([NPT b, T b])
                 |                             |
       <{NPT b, NPT a}, {}, {}>               null

Solver


public Solver()
Method Detail

solve


public java.util.ArrayList<Interpretation> solve(java.util.ArrayList<Formula> list)
Produces interpretation schemes for a set of PPIIL formulas. It rearranges the content of the list so that the non-branching formulas precede the branching ones. Then the new list is expanded using expand.

Parameters:
list - a list of PPIIL formulas
Returns:
a set of interpretation schemes

expand


private java.util.ArrayList<Interpretation> expand(java.util.ArrayList<Formula> list)
Expands a branch of a tableau. list represents a branch in the tableau. expand finds the first formula in the branch for which expansion rule can be applied and which is not already extended(used before). If this formula is branching then expand calls itself twice for each branch and merges the result of each of them. Otherwise if this formula does not create branch then expand calls itself recursively for the updated branch and return the result.

Parameters:
list - a list of formulas in a branch of tableau
Returns:
set of interpretation schemes

checkClosure


private java.util.ArrayList<Interpretation> checkClosure(java.util.ArrayList<Formula> list)
Checks whether a branch is closed or not.

Parameters:
list - a set of formulas representing a branch of tableau
Returns:
null if the branch is closed, otherwise an interpretation satisfying the branch.

applyRule


private java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<Formula>> applyRule(Formula f)
Apply tableau expansion rule for a formula. For example, applyRule(T a -> b) returns [[NPT a], [T b]] applyRule(NPT a -> b) returns [[T a, NPT b]]

Parameters:
f - a formula
Returns:
a list of list of formulas

applyCondIonRules1


private java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<Formula>> applyCondIonRules1(Formula f,

                                                                             int[] args)
Applies rules for conditional ion 0,1,2,5,8. Their structure differ from from the rest in the rule for NT formulas. Parameters are used as follows: 
     
 T *0(f, false)   NT*0(f, false)    PT*0(f, false)   NPT*0(f, false)
 |                |                 |                |
 a0 f a1          a2 f a3           a4 f a5          a6 f a7
 

                   T *0(f1, f2)
     -------------------------------------------
    a8  f1 a9                         a11 f1 a12
    a10 f2
                  NT *0(f1, f2)
                  |
                  a13 f1 a14
    ---------------------------------------------
   a15 f1 a16                              a18 f2
   a17 f2
                  PT *0(f1, f2)
   ----------------------------------------------
   a19 f1 a20                              a22 f2
   a21 f2
                  NPT *0(f1, f2)
                  |
                  a23 f1 24
                  a25 f2

Parameters:
f -
args - an array of length 26, containing all the parameters.
Returns:

applyCondIonRules2


private java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<Formula>> applyCondIonRules2(Formula f,

                                                                             int[] args)
Applies rules for conditional ion 3,4,6,7. Parameters are used as follows: 
 T *0(f, false)   NT*0(f, false)    PT*0(f, false)   NPT*0(f, false)
 |                |                 |                |
 a0 f a1          a2 f a3           a4 f a5          a6 f a7
 

                   T *0(f1, f2)
     -------------------------------------------
    a8  f1 a9                         a11 f1 a12
    a10 f2
                  NT *0(f1, f2)
                  |
                  a13 f1 a14
                  a15 f2
 

                  PT *0(f1, f2)
   ----------------------------------------------
   a16 f1 a17                              a19 f2
   a18 f2
                  NPT *0(f1, f2)
                  |
                  a20 f1 21
                  a22 f2

Parameters:
f -
args - an array of length 23, containing all the parameters.
Returns:
